body_html:
@00hello I skipped this approach and went ahead with training the network on tensor flow and directly copied the weights for caffe2 net. The approach worked fine for me and I was able to get a caffe2 model for running on the client side for style transfer.

Apart from that you can also look into the latest branch https://github.com/pytorch/examples/tree/master/fast_neural_style as the community has updated the code with onnx conversion. Although I was facing some problem in it but the best part was onnx export was successful with the latest commit.
body_text:
@00hello I skipped this approach and went ahead with training the network on tensor flow and directly copied the weights for caffe2 net. The approach worked fine for me and I was able to get a caffe2 model for running on the client side for style transfer.
Apart from that you can also look into the latest branch https://github.com/pytorch/examples/tree/master/fast_neural_style as the community has updated the code with onnx conversion. Although I was facing some problem in it but the best part was onnx export was successful with the latest commit.
body:
@00hello I skipped this approach and went ahead with training the network on tensor flow and directly copied the weights for caffe2 net. The approach worked fine for me and I was able to get a caffe2 model for running on the client side for style transfer.

Apart from that you can also look into the latest branch https://github.com/pytorch/examples/tree/master/fast_neural_style as the community has updated the code with onnx conversion. Although I was facing some problem in it but the best part was onnx export was successful with the latest commit.
